DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Pathology Specimen Response Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The code that identifies whether or not the pathologic specimen was obtained during the procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A field of anatomical pathology in which living tissue is surgically removed for the purpose of diagnosis and treatment.:A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._Surgical Procedure is a diagnostic or treatment medical procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A field of anatomical pathology in which living tissue is surgically removed for the purpose of diagnosis and treatment.:A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: A field of anatomical pathology in which tissue or cells removed from a living organism are macroscopically and microscopically reviewed for the purpose of disease diagnosis.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Surgical Procedure is a diagnostic or treatment medical procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The code that represents the final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of a statement (either spoken or written) that is made in reply to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A statement (either spoken or written) that is made in reply to a question, request, criticism, or accusation.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A statement (either spoken or written) that is made in reply to a question, request, criticism, or accusation.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
